attributes.action: Have a second Local Election Vote as we are not happy with the first on May 2nd
attributes.background: Seeing as the remoaners want to have another referendum because its not the result they want. We demand a second local election for the areas who voted on May 2nd 2019 as Labour, Conservative and Liberals are getting seats on councils. We will keep going until every council is UKIP

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Local council elections are held every four years, so we're not sure what else you'd like to happen. 

You can see the timetable for local elections here: 

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/792138/Election_Timetable_in_England_2019.pdf
